definition: the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish

sentences.english: Shanghai, a lot of Spanish books in bookstores.
sentences.chinese: 上海的書店有很多西班牙語的書籍。

sentences.english: She meant for me to learn Spanish through Shakira's songs.
sentences.chinese: 她當時是想讓我通過聽夏奇拉的歌學好西班牙語。
我特別擅長說西班牙語。

sentences.english: I know no more Spanish than I know Greek.
sentences.chinese: 我對西班牙語和希臘語同樣不懂。

sentences.english: During that time, he also learned Spanish and  Portuguese as a hobby.
sentences.chinese: 作爲業餘愛好，他還學習了西班牙語和葡萄牙語。

sentences.english: Some Americans from Spanish-speaking families follow a tradition for the New Year that involves fruit.
sentences.chinese: 有些說西班牙語的美國人遵循着喫水果的新年傳統。

sentences.english: The European startup provides how-to guides in English and Spanish.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲人開始提供英語和西班牙語的指引指南。

sentences.english: Santa Fe means "Holy Faith" in Spanish.
sentences.chinese: 聖達菲，西班牙語的意思是“神聖的信仰”。

sentences.english: The students come largely from poor, Spanish-speaking families.
sentences.chinese: 這些學生多數來自說西班牙語的低收入家庭。

sentences.english: Spanish is an official language on four continents and is the mother tongue in 21 countries.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙語是四大洲21個國家的母語和官方語言。

sentences.english: so their grammar is very ingrained in Spanish, which is different than English.
sentences.chinese: 他們的語法是基於西班牙語的，與英語截然不同。

sentences.english: The Spanish collator used the less-than sign.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙語排序器使用了小於號。

sentences.english: Then, she reads it again in Spanish.
sentences.chinese: 之後，她又用西班牙語朗讀了一遍。

sentences.english: Have your kids and grand kids learn Spanish - they'll need it.
sentences.chinese: 你們的後代將會學西班牙語，他們會需要它的。

sentences.english: Spanish is spoken by many_people, and Indian is spoken , too .
sentences.chinese: 西班牙語被大多數人講，印第安語也被講。

sentences.english: She chanced to speak fluent Spanish.
sentences.chinese: 她偏巧很會說西班牙語。

definition: Korean language (esp. in context of South Korea)
hangul, Korean phonetic alphabet/Korean written language
